abstract.original_text: Background and Purpose Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) has a high mortality rate and pandemic potential. However, the neurological manifestations of MERS have rarely been reported since it first emerged in 2012.

sentences.segment_text: Background and Purpose Middle East respiratory syndrome ( MERS ) has a high mortality rate and pandemic potential .
However , the neurological manifestations of MERS have rarely been reported since it first emerged in 2012 .

abstract.original_text: We evaluated four patients with laboratory-confirmed MERS coronavirus (CoV) infections who showed neurological complications during MERS treatment. These 4 patients were from a cohort of 23 patients who were treated at a single designated hospital during the 2015 outbreak in the Republic of Korea. The clinical presentations, laboratory findings, and prognoses are described.

sentences.segment_text: We evaluated four patients with laboratory-confirmed MERS coronavirus ( CoV ) infections who showed neurological complications during MERS treatment .
